eecs.jago
Class SimEngine

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--java.awt.Component
        |
        +--java.awt.Container
              |
              +--javax.swing.JComponent
                    |
                    +--javax.swing.JPanel
                          |
                          +--eecs.jago.SimEngine
All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.accessibility.Accessible, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, Realism, java.io.Serializable
public class SimEngine
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements Realism

The simulation engine that is responsible for managing the addition, deletion, and updating of all elements of the simulation.

The simulation uses a scale that was originally based on the Lego Mindstorms based robot. Using the standard robot images (a robot with tracks and no sensors or bumpers is 38x30 pixels), this defaults to a scale of 1:6 (one inch = 6 pixels). Although the perception of this scale can be skewed by adding other SimElements that do not adhere to this scale, it is important to remember as the default when considering movement speeds.

See MobileElement for more details on how movement is replicated at this scale.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Field Detail

collisionDetector

protected CollisionDetector collisionDetector
Detects collisions between two Collidable elements. The SimEngine owns the detector, but gives it to the ElementManager to use.

Manages double buffering and updating the background

Sets the background tile.

Parameters:
image - The Image to use as a tiled background. This method will tile the specified image to fill the entire simulation (it will not change the size of the simulation).

add

public void add(SimElement element,
                double x,
                double y)
Adds an element to the sim engine's element manager. Changes:
  • (5.1) Allows All elements that implement Reflective to be added anywhere
  • (5.0) Checks for overlap and denies addition of overlapping objects

Parameters:
element - The SimElement to add to the simulation.
x - The desired x (horizontal) coordinate for the element.
y - The desired y (vertical) coordinate for the element.
Since:
4.1

addActionListener

public void addActionListener(java.awt.event.ActionListener listener)
Adds the listener as a listener to the simulation execution timer.

Parameters:
listener - an ActionListener to add

deltaTickTimeMillis

public long deltaTickTimeMillis()
Calculates the difference in milliseconds between the current tick and the last tick. Used for elements that require the real-time that has elapsed during the simulation. Although the simulation notifies elements at regular intervals, due to thread timing, the intervals are not guaranteed to correlate with realtime. This method ensures that real-time is reported to elements.

Returns:
The amount of time that has passed since the last tick, in milliseconds

elapsedTimeMillis

public long elapsedTimeMillis()
Returns the total elapsed time in the simulation

Returns:
DOCUMENT ME!
